caption.p: Oxidation of 1-ABT (compound 1) produces benzyne, which can be chemically trapped to give 1,2,3,4-tetraphenylnaphthalene.

Heme adduct formed by reaction of the heme of cytochrome P450 with autocatalytically activated 1-ABT. The peripheral substituents on the porphyrin are only shown schematically, as isomeric structures that differ in the pattern of peripheral substitution are possible.
Two possible mechanisms for the P450-catalyzed oxidation of 1-ABT to benzyne, where [Por+.Fe(IV)=O] stands for the activated iron oxo species of cytochrome P450.
Metabolites of 1-ABT formed in vivo in rats.
Possible mechanism for the P450-catalyzed conversion of 1-ABT to benzotriazole.
Analogues of 1-ABT with variants of the core 1-aminobenzotriazole structure are not effective mechanism-based inactivating agents.

A possible mechanism for the formation of a nitroso compound that could coordinate to the heme iron of P450, resulting in observation of MI complexes. The reaction scheme shown is a modified version of that proposed by Sinal and Bend [90]. The R stands for H, Me, or Et, depending on whether it refers to experiments with compound 13, 14, or 15 (Table 2), respectively.
Metabolites of thiazopyr and GNE-892 produced by cytochrome P450.
Cytochrome P450 catalyzed oxidation resulting in a reduced metabolite.
Metabolites of nevirapine formed by cytochrome P450 enzymes.
The cytochrome P450-catalyzed transformation of tienilic acid to a glutathione conjugate is inhibited by 1-ABT.
The hepatic metabolism of desloratadine elucidated with the help of 1-ABT.
Epoxidation of precocene.
Oxidation of 3-methylindole to a reactive methylene iminium product that alkylates proteins.
Oxidation of cinnamic acid by cinnamic acid 4-hydroxylase in the biosynthesis of phenylpropanoids in plants.
Structure of schisandrin B.
Formation of 9,12,13-trihydroxy-10(E)-octadecenoic acid in Solanum lypoersicum (tomato).
Pathways for the biosynthesis of hüorhammericine from tabersonine in the biogenesis of vindoline.
Structures of some of the herbicide agents whose metabolism is shown by studies with 1-ABT to involve cytochrome P450 enzymes.
Two intermediates in the biosynthesis of enokipodin A, B, C, and D identified as a result of inhibition of P450 enzymes by 1-ABT. The two intermediates are shown in the boxes.
Some compounds for which the role of P450 versus FMO has been investigated using 1-ABT as a P450 inactivating agent.
Analogues of 1-ABT shown to inactivate cytochrome P450 enzymes.

fn.label: a
fn.p: Loss of P450 content on incubation of phenobarbital-induced rat liver microsomes with 1 mM inhibitor for 30 min.

fn.label: b
fn.p: Loss of P450 content on incubation of β-naphthoflavone induced rabbit lung microsomes with 10 μM inhibitor.

fn.label: c
fn.p: Loss of P450 content on incubation of untreated guinea pig pulmonary microsomes with 10 μM inhibitor for 45 min.

caption.p: Consequences of the inhibition of 1-ABT-mediated P450 metabolism of a range of compounds.

tr.td: Raised flurazepam brain concentration, confirming the parent drug is the active species
Inhibited oxidation by rat to thiofuran methyl sulfoxide
Inhibited oxidation by rat to thiofuran methyl sulfoxide
Partially inhibited clearance of drug in rats
Showed two metabolites are cytochrome P450-dependent
Showed P450 involved in formation of desaturated metabolites
Inhibited the formation of a novel metabolite
Inhibited in vivo formation of several metabolites
Inhibited metabolism of the drug by human liver microsomes
Inhibited metabolite formation and intrinsic clearance by human liver microsomes
In vivo, decreased GSH adduct formation by 95%
Showed gut bacteria reduced the =N-OH to =NH, but liver P450s catalyzed N-dealkylation
Showed parent drug is responsible for the cardiopulmonary toxicity
Showed oxidative metabolism not rate limiting in excretion of this drug
Established keto reduction to triadimenol is not by a P450 enzyme
Brain exposure required for therapy achieved when 1-ABT coadministered
Increased plasma exposure of the drug when administered with 1-ABT
1-ABT increased t1/2 and reduced the dose required for efficacy

caption.p: Effect of 1-ABT on arachidonic acid pathways.

tr.td: 1-ABT inhibits contraction of ductus arteriosus by oxygen, implicating a P450based mechanism
1-ABT inhibits cardiodepression by acetylcholine, implying a role for P450 and EETs
1-ABT, unlike miconazole, did not influence endothelium-dependent hyperpolarization
As 1-ABT did not counteract the effect, EDHF released by acetylcholine is not a P450-derived arachidonic acid metabolite
1-ABT abolished the blood pressure increase due to intrarenal acetylcholine; implicates 20-HETE but not EETs in the process
1-ABT abolished cardiodepression by bradykinin, implying a role for P450 and 14,15-EET
1-ABT does not inhibit bradykinin increases in perfusion of the medulla mediated by the NO system and K(Ca) channels
1-ABT prevented the decrease in left ventricular pressure caused by bradykinin
1-ABT inhibited cyclosporin A mediated increases of 20-HETE, systolic blood pressure, and renal damage
1-ABT blocked the renal vasodilatory response to NO and reduced its diuretic and natriuretic effects
1-ABT and NO synthase inhibitors blunted ATP mediated increases in renal arterial blood flow
1-ABT diminished CYP4A activity but did not prevent the NO mediated decrease in mean arterial pressure (MAP)
1-ABT prevented the increases in systolic blood pressure caused by an NO donor, suggesting a role for 20-HETE
1-ABT reversed inhibition of Na+-K+−2Cl- cotransport caused by NO, implying a role for a P450-enzyme
1-ABT attenuated elevation of blood pressure caused by L-NAME and lowered organ damage
Rat carotid body type I cells
1-ABT inhibited hypoxic depression of K+ currents, suggesting a P450 enzyme is involved
Rat carotid body type I cells
1-ABT did not alter the effects of arachidonic acid on K+ currents, suggesting they are not mediated by a P450 enzyme
1-ABT, unlike miconazole, does not interfere with K+ channel activation, negating a general P450 effect
1-ABT, unlike ketoconazole, had no effect on native KDR or RPV Kv1.5 current, implying P450 inhibition not critical for ketoconazole effect
1-ABT reversibly inhibited steady-state K+v channel currents and membrane potential, but interpretation unclear
1-ABT inhibited the doubling of mean arterial blood pressure mediated by angiotensin
Chronic blockade of EETs and 20-HETE with 1-ABT attenuated the ANG IIinduced rise in MAP by 40%
1-ABT, angiotensin II, and endothelin individually reduced blood pressure to similar levels, and more in combination
1-ABT attenuated vasoconstrictor responses to norepinephrine, endothelin-1, and angiotensin II
1-ABT decreased blood pressure in postmenopausal, but not young, spontaneously hypertensive rats, implicating a 20-HETE contribution to postmenopausal hypertension
1-ABT decreased systolic blood pressure, urinary sodium, urinary 20-HETE, renal 20-HETE
1-ABT decreased MAP in rats with reduced uterine perfusion pressure and lowered both 20-HETE formation and CYP4A expression
Blockade of CaMKII, Ras-GTPase or the production of 20-HETE by 1-ABT normalized the altered vascular reactivity to ET-1 and carbachol in the carotid artery of streptozotocin-induced diabetic rats
In the presence of testosterone, the 1-ABT inhibitable Cyp4A/20-HETE system plays a key role in elevating blood pressure secondary to insulin resistance
1-ABT decreased the pressure-natriuretic response by 50% and renal formation of 20-HETE and ETAs by 90% and 50%, respectively
1-ABT reduced the natriuretic response to dopamine by 65% and markedly reduced urine flow and sodium excretion
1-ABT reduced hypertension in a DOCA-salt model but did not prevent organ hypertrophy and proteinuria
1-ABT decreased renal artery flow without altering medullary perfusion, whereas medullary NO increased
1-ABT in Ren-2 transgenic rats decreased blood pressure and cardiac hypertrophy, but not glomerulosclerosis, implicating P450 metabolites
1-ABT partially inhibited the myogenic response to elevated perfusion pressure; suggested a role for 20-HETE in the myogenic response
1-ABT prevents the increase in 20-HETE levels caused by balloon injury and attenuated vascular smooth muscle cell remodeling,
1-ABT blocked the increase in 20-HETE and angiogenesis caused by electrical stimulation
1-ABT prevented the inhibition of sPLA2-II expression caused by low (5 μM) but not high (30 μM) concentrations of arachidonic acid
1-ABT did not block the inhibitory effect of arachidonic acid on currents due to the α1β2γ2 GABA(A) receptor
1-ABT decreased 12(S)-HETE levels, 3T6 fibroblast growth, and DNA synthesis induced by FBS
1-ABT, unlike ketoconazole, did not alter baseline [Ca2+] or CCK-evoked oscillations
1-ABT partially inhibited immediate arachidonic acid-induced pulmonary vasodilation, suggesting a role for P450 enzymes
1-ABT inhibited vasoconstriction caused by hypoxia and angiotensin II, but not when 1-ABT was washed out first-conclude 1-ABT does not act through a P450 mechanism
Hypoxia-induced vasoconstriction was inhibited by 1-ABT, but similar inhibition was observed under normoxia with a thromboxane analogue.
1-ABT greatly attenuated airway sensitivity and the increases in 20-HETE caused by ozone

caption.p: Effect of 1-ABT on estradiol-dependent pathways.

tr.td: Inhibition by 1-ABT suggests estradiol inhibits cardiac fibroblast growth via an estrogen receptor-independent pathway involving metabolism of estradiol to methoxyestradiols
Estradiol inhibited, serum-induced, proliferation of glomerular mesangial cells was enhanced by P450 inducers and diminished by 1-ABT
Estradiol inhibited, serum-induced, proliferation of vascular smooth muscle cells was enhanced by P450 inducers and diminished by 1-ABT
Human coronary artery smooth muscle cells
Estradiol inhibited, serum-induced, proliferation of smooth muscle cells was enhanced by P450 inducers and diminished by 1-ABT
Estradiol inhibited, serum-induced, proliferation of human cardiac fibroblasts was enhanced by P450 inducers and diminished by 1-ABT
Cultured rat vascular smooth muscle cells
1-ABT increased the growth promoting effect of 17β-estradiol by inhibiting formation of 2- and 4-hydroxyestradiol and reactive oxygen species
17β-estradiol inhibition of phenylephrine-induced contraction was not prevented by 1-ABT, suggesting a P450-independent mechanism

caption.p: Some toxicological processes in which cytochrome P450 enzymes were implicated though inhibition by 1-ABT.

tr.td: Inhibition of 8-hydroxy-efavirenz formation and hepatic cell death
Formation of reactive metabolite and genotoxic potential
Mutagenicity assays in Chinese hamster V79 cells expressing CYP2E1 and SULT 1A1
Nephrotoxic metabolite formation and renal damage
Vacuolar degeneration and necrosis of adrenal cortex
Decreased biliary excretion of the compound in rats

caption.p: Some toxicological processes not inhibited by 1-ABT and therefore unlikely to involve cytochrome P450 enzymes as active participants.

tr.td: Formation of protein adducts in normal human epidermal keratinocytes
Toxicity to human and rat primary hepatocytes
p-Aminophenol mediated changes in renal proximal tubules
Cytotoxicity to Fa32 and human Hep G2 cells
